alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 9:27PM EDT until April 14 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Elliston....and at Edwardsport down to Petersburg. .Following areas of one to two inches of rainfall on Wednesday... lowland, minor flooding along the East Fork White River...continues at Seymour...while on the White River minor flooding has resumed at Elliston...and continues at Edwardsport and points downriver. The crest on the East Fork White River has passed Seymour...yet this slowly passing crest is expected to hold Lawrence County points in action stage to near bankfull into early next week. The White River is forecast to crest this weekend. Flooding is expected to continue on the East Fork White River at Seymour into Saturday...while aforementioned points on the White River should remain in minor flood into next week. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Dry conditions are expected through next week... which will allow the lowest portions of the White River to crest and fall below flood by next weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, APRIL 14... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Friday, April 14. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding affects higher bottomlands and may affect a few residents in an area known as Dodge City. Local roads leading to Dodge City area are flooded. State Road 257 south of Washington completely floods at this level if Shoals remains above 16 feet. Ditch Road begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Thursday /7:30 PM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 19.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Thursday /7:30 PM CDT Thursday/ was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Friday.
